result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew G Engberg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Must report to Probation today (4/20/16).
Must follow rules of Probation.
If Probation feels appropriate, may petition for early discharge at 6 months.

miscConds.notes: $265.60 fine/cost to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Must provide DNA sample and pay a $200.00 DNA surcharge to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Subject to Work Release.  NOT subject to Good Time.
No Contacts to be determined by Probation.

timeConds.notes:
Banked/stayed for use by Probation if necessary.
Time may be served in another county as long as there is no cost to Polk County.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Matthew G Engberg in court with attorney Dan Firkus.  Daniel Joseph Tolan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 9:48 am.  
ADA-motion to amend to D/C, removing domestic enhancer (repeater remains).  Amended Complaint to be filed.  CT-Count 1 AMENDED strking domestic enhancer.  Def-guilty.  CT-accept plea, adj guilty & judgment entered.  Exh 1-victim impact statement-O&R.

SENTENCE:  w/h, probation up to 1 yr.  If probation feels approp, may petition for early discharge at 6 mo.  No contacts are left up to probation/parole.  Follow rules of probation.  60 days CT, banked - no GT, subj to WR.  May be served in another county as long as no cost to Polk Co.  Must report to Probation today.  $265.60, DNA sample & $200 surcharge.  Payable to COCC, 60 dtp or set pp, ftp-judgment.  PCR.  10:17 am adj.

Defendant Matthew G Engberg in court with attorney Dan Firkus.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 9:49 am.  Bond cont.  9:53 am adj.  Jury trial scheduled for March 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Matthew G Engberg
Current: 1715 South Deer Lake Circle, Saint Croix Falls, WI 54024 United States  (Effective: 12-15-2015)
Prior: 1715 South Deer Lake Circle, Richfield, MN 55423
Not to have contact with: Mandy Engberg.  No abusive contact with Gregory Engbert. Must comply with all mental health treatment and follow ups as required in his MN civil commitment.

Defendant Matthew G Engberg in court.  Daniel Joseph Tolan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Dan Firkus appeared by phone means for Defendant Matthew G Engberg. RL-clerk 1:25 pm. Atty Tolan addresses Ct. ADA requesting cash bond. Atty Firkus addresses Ct. CT quashes warrant. CT sets new bond. Bond cont. File to br 2 JA. 1:39 pm adj.

Attorney Daniel E. Firkus in court.  Defendant does not appear.  Stephen C. Dorrance appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  KK Clerk 11:45AM ADA Dorrance requesting warrant.  Court - warrant authorized and stayed until next friday the 24th.  adj.  11:47AM
Report in support of probable cause for arrest. Request for criminal complaint
Not to have contact with: Gregory Engbert, Mandy Engberg.

Defendant Matthew G Engberg in court with attorney Daniel E. Firkus.  Defendant Matthew G Engberg in custody.  Stephen C. Dorrance appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 1:45 pm.  Firkus-qualifies, NG plea.  CT sets bond.  WST.  1:51 pm adj.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.
